excerpt: Ornate religious buildings line this iconic monastic complex, known for its network of catacombs.
detail_description: Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra, also known as the Lavra, is a UNESCO World Heritage-listed Orthodox Christian monastery complex in Kyiv. It features ornate religious buildings such as the Dormition Church, refectory, and bell tower. One of its main attractions is the network of underground catacombs where mummified remains of former monks are laid to rest.
name: Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra

excerpt: Orthodox cathedral, founded in 1037, with monastic buildings, a gilt cupola, necropolis and museum.
detail_description: St. Sophia's Cathedral, an Orthodox cathedral founded in 1037, is a significant monument in Kyiv with its gilt cupola, monastic buildings, necropolis and museum. The arrival of architect Gottfried Schedel brought Western European influence to the city's architecture, resulting in structures like the Great Bell Tower and St. Sophia Monastery. The cathedral is part of a trio of golden-domed Orthodox churches in Kyiv that includes Kiev Pechersk Lavra and St.
name: St. Sophia's Cathedral

excerpt: 1980s replica of 11th-century Golden Gate, the main fortified entrance to the medieval city.
detail_description: Golden Gate, also known as Zoloti Vorota, is a popular attraction in Kyiv. Dating back to 1037 and restored in 1982, it marks the site of the city's former walls. The structure is a replica of the original fortified entrance to the medieval city and has been a point of controversy due to its design not matching the original. Visitors can climb to the top for panoramic views of the CBD and enjoy performances by musicians around the gate.
name: Golden Gate

excerpt: Site comprising of a cathedral, bell tower, refectory & gates, all built in Ukrainian Baroque style.
detail_description: St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery is a historic site in Kiev, Ukraine, featuring a cathedral, bell tower, refectory, and gates all built in the Ukrainian Baroque style. The monastery was founded in 1108 by Sviatopolk Iziaslavovych and is dedicated to Michael the Archangel. It is renowned for being the first cathedral in Kyiv with gilded domes made of solid gold leaf.
name: St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery

excerpt: Lavish 18th-century baroque church sitting on a hill overlooking one of Kiev's oldest neighborhoods.
detail_description: St. Andrew's Church, also known as the Cathedral of St. Andrew, is an opulent 18th-century baroque church located on a hill that offers stunning views of one of Kiev's oldest neighborhoods. The church overlooks the ancient Podil district and is a prominent landmark in the city with its vibrant architecture featuring a large dome and five smaller cupolas.
name: St. Andrew's Church

excerpt: Huge statue atop the National Museum of the History of the Great Patriotic War of 1941–1945.
detail_description: The Ukrainian Motherland Monument, towering over the National Museum of the History of Ukraine in World War Two, offers visitors breathtaking panoramic views of Kyiv from its 102-meter-high pedestal. This colossal stainless steel statue, unveiled in 1981, symbolizes the resilience and spirit of the Ukrainian people. As one of the world's tallest statues, it stands as a tribute to Soviet soldiers and is surrounded by a park featuring military displays and a World War II Museum.
name: Ukrainian Motherland Monument

excerpt: Scientific museum with a collection of items ranging from prehistoric artifacts to folk art.
detail_description: The National Museum of the History of Ukraine in World War II is a memorial complex that serves as a tribute to the 11,600 soldiers who lost their lives during the war. The museum has an extensive collection of artifacts from prehistoric times up until present day, and is well-curated with moving photo galleries.
name: National Museum of the History of Ukraine

excerpt: Neo-Byzantine cathedral with bright yellow facade, opening to a gold-accented fresco-lined interior.
detail_description: St. Volodymyr's Cathedral is a stunning Neo-Byzantine church in Kiev, Ukraine. Its bright yellow exterior is adorned with gold accents and frescoes, creating a vibrant and picturesque facade. The interior is equally impressive, featuring colorful frescoes and a golden-domed ceiling. This relatively recent church was built in the late 19th century to commemorate 900 years of Christianity in Ukraine. Visitors can experience Ukrainian Orthodox services and admire the art nouveau interiors.
name: St. Volodymyr's Cathedral

excerpt: Many political rallies have taken place in this historic central square with musical fountains.
detail_description: Independence Square, also known as Maydan Nezalezhnosti, is a historic central square in Kiev that has been the site of numerous political rallies and protests. The square features musical fountains and the massive Independence Column. While it was once a site of political upheaval, it now hosts music stages and souvenir stalls. On weekends, the main road that dissects the square is closed to traffic, allowing visitors to wander freely without concerns about vehicles.
name: Independence Square

excerpt: Charming public park showcasing offbeat local artwork, including abstract sculptures & mosaics.
detail_description: Park Landscape Alley is a charming public park in Kiev that features unique local artwork, such as abstract sculptures and mosaics. The city of Kiev offers a mix of old-school Russian and new Ukrainian culture, with attractions like St Cyril's Monastery, St Sophia Cathedral, the Great Patriotic War Museum, and the National Chernobyl Museum. Pechersk Landscape Park, also known as Song Festival Field, is part of this cultural landscape.
name: Park Landscape Alley

excerpt: Museum detailing the Chernobyl nuclear disaster, with audio-visual exhibits, photos & documents.
detail_description: The Ukrainian National Chernobyl Museum offers a poignant and informative look into the 1986 Chernobyl nuclear disaster. The museum features audio-visual exhibits, photographs, documents, and artifacts from the site itself. It commemorates the heroics of the first rescue workers and provides a three-phase diorama showing the nuclear plant before, during, and after the accident.
name: Ukrainian National Chernobyl Museum

excerpt: Podil or Podol, also known in English as the Lower City, is a historic neighborhood in Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine. It is located on a floodplain terrace over the Dnieper between the Kyiv Hills and the lower stream of Pochaina River. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Podil, also known as Podol or the Lower City, is a historic neighborhood in Kyiv, Ukraine. Situated on a floodplain terrace between the Kyiv Hills and the lower stream of Pochaina River, this area has been a hub for over four centuries. The district boasts old streets and youthful energy, attracting visitors with urban beaches, trendy hangouts, and the 17th-century Kyiv-Mohyla Academy.
name: Podil

excerpt: 19th-century neo-classical museum with works ranging from medieval icons to 20th-century art.
detail_description: The National Art Museum of Ukraine, a 19th-century neo-classical museum, houses an impressive collection of over 40 thousand exhibits. It is renowned for its rich assortment of icon paintings, classical works from the 19th century, and a diverse range of graphics spanning from Kievan Rus to contemporary pieces. Visitors can admire works by prominent artists such as Repin, Shevchenko, Vrubel, Tropinin, and Borovikovsky.
name: National Art Museum of Ukraine

excerpt: Lavish opera house built in the neo-Renaissance style in 1901, hosting ballets & concerts.
detail_description: The National Opera of Ukraine, also known as the Taras Shevchenko National Opera of Ukraine, is a lavish opera house in Kiev. Built in 1901 in the neo-Renaissance style, it has been a cultural mainstay since 1867. The impressive structure was rebuilt after a fire in the 1980s and now offers modern amenities.
name: National Opera of Ukraine

excerpt: Reconstructed Baroque palace & official residence of Ukraine's president, first completed in 1752.
detail_description: Nestled on the picturesque hilly banks of the Dnipro River, Mariyinsky Palace stands as a stunning example of Baroque architecture and a significant historical landmark in Kyiv. Completed in 1752, this magnificent structure was designed by the renowned architect Bartolomeo Rastrelli at the behest of Empress Elizaveta Petrovna. Originally serving as the official residence for Kyiv's governor, it later became a key site for Ukrainian governance during Soviet times.
name: Mariyinsky Palace

excerpt: Landscaped park with paved pathways, trees & benches, plus monuments, a fountain & a playground.
detail_description: Mariinsky Park, previously known as Tsarsky, is a beautifully landscaped park in the Pechersk neighborhood of Kyiv. It features paved pathways, lush trees, benches, monuments, a fountain, and a playground. The park's history dates back to Empress Maria Alexandrivna's order to create an English-style park on the site of the palace square and military parade-ground.
name: Mariinsky Park

excerpt: Kyiv, also Kiev, is the capital and most populous city of Ukraine. Located in the north-central part of the country, it straddles both sides of the Dnieper River. As of 1 January 2022, its population was 2,952,301, making Kyiv the seventh-most populous city in Europe. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kyiv, the capital and largest city of Ukraine, is situated in north-central Ukraine along the Dnieper River. With a population of nearly 3 million people, it ranks as the seventh-most populous city in Europe. Known for its significance as an industrial, scientific, educational, and cultural hub in Eastern Europe, Kyiv offers a diverse range of experiences for visitors.
name: Kyiv

excerpt: Contemporary art gallery within a historic building, with 6 floors including a video-lounge & cafe.
detail_description: Located in a historic building, the Pinchuk Art Centre is a contemporary art gallery that was established in 2006 by Victor Pinchuk. It aims to promote contemporary art and culture through various exhibitions, events, and educational programs. The center hosts solo and group exhibitions by both established and emerging artists, along with lectures, workshops, and film screenings. Additionally, it is home to the annual PinchukArtPrize which supports young artists from Ukraine and the CIS region.
name: Pinchuk Art Centre
address: вул. Велика Васильківська, Baseina St, 1, 3-2, Kyiv, Ukraine, 01004

excerpt: Museum with an extensive collection of foreign art, including European, Asian & ancient works.
detail_description: The Khanenko Museum, located in Kyiv, is renowned for its extensive and valuable collection of European, Asian, and ancient art. The museum boasts original works by prominent European masters like Pieter Paul Rubens and Gentile Bellini. Its diverse collection includes European sculpture, decorative art, as well as rare pieces from Iranian, Tibetan, Chinese, and Japanese origins.
name: Khanenko Museum

excerpt: Lined by neo-classical buildings, the city's main street is home to high-end shops & restaurants.
detail_description: Khreschatyk St is the main street in Kiev, lined with elegant neo-classical buildings and home to upscale shops and dining options. A stroll along this bustling thoroughfare offers a chance to savor unique ice cream flavors, witness historic sites like Independence Square, and explore nearby attractions such as St. Michaels Monastery and St. Sophias Cathedral. The area also boasts lively bars and local restaurants, making it a popular destination for visitors seeking vibrant nightlife experiences.
name: Khreschatyk St

excerpt: Aviation museum with around 70 airplanes & helicopters plus air weapons, drones & aircraft engines.
detail_description: The Oleg Antonov State Aviation Museum, located near Zhulyany Airport in Kyiv, Ukraine, is a must-visit for aviation enthusiasts. It boasts an impressive collection of over 70 airplanes and helicopters, as well as air weapons, drones, and aircraft engines. Visitors can explore iconic Soviet models like the MiG fighters, Tupolev bombers, and Antonov transport planes. The museum offers a unique opportunity to enter some of the aircraft on display.
name: Oleg Antonov State Aviation Museum

excerpt: Extensive botanical gardens with a remarkable variety of flora, plus exotic plants in glasshouses.
detail_description: Kyiv National Botanical Garden is a vast and extensive botanical garden that boasts a remarkable variety of flora, including exotic plants housed in glasshouses. It's not just a seasonal attraction; visitors flock to this UNESCO-protected site throughout the year to enjoy romantic walks amidst beautiful trees and flowers. The garden's sprawling green slopes provide the perfect setting for relaxation and contemplation, making it an ideal spot for couples to unwind with nature.
name: Kyiv National Botanical Garden

excerpt: One of Ukraine's oldest botanic institutions with around 9,000 native & non-native plant species.
detail_description: A.V. Fomin Botanical Garden, one of Ukraine's oldest botanical institutions, is home to around 9,000 native and non-native plant species. Located in the city center of Kiev, this small park is a popular walking spot and offers diverse terrain for photographers to capture unique angles.
name: A.V. Fomin Botanical Garden

excerpt: Rustic island in the Dnieper River offering beaches, cycling/running paths, picnic areas & cafes.
detail_description: Trukhaniv Island, located in the Dnieper River, is a rustic retreat offering a variety of activities for visitors. During the day, it's an ideal spot for picnics and sunbathing, with beaches, cycling paths, and picnic areas available. At night, the island transforms into a lively party venue with beach nightclubs and sports complexes like X-Park.
name: Trukhaniv Island

excerpt: Popular city park with a paved walking track, a playground, cafes & a restaurant.
detail_description: Taras Shevchenko Park is a popular city park with top-notch infrastructure, featuring a paved walking track, playground, cafes, and a restaurant. It boasts an art area with designer benches and statues that are considered modern works of art. Established in the mid-19th century on previously wild land near Ukraine's main university, the park offers beautiful alleys and intriguing historical landmarks.
name: Taras Shevchenko Park

detail_description: Arsenalna is a remarkable metro station located in Kyiv, Ukraine. It holds the title for being the deepest underground station globally, situated over 105 meters below ground level. The station features two lengthy escalators that take around 5 minutes to descend to the platforms. Commuters often make use of this time by reading or using their phones on the escalator steps.
name: Arsenalna

excerpt: Institution named for one of Ukraine's major literary & artistic figures, with botanical gardens.
detail_description: Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv is a renowned institution named after the prominent Ukrainian literary and artistic figure. The university is located on the wide Boulevard of Taras Shevchenko, intersecting Khreshchatyk at right angles. Its main building, known as the Red Building, showcases Russian Classicism architecture with monumental columns from the mid-19th century. Additionally, the Institute of International Relations building exhibits Soviet Constructivism style with minimalistic design and grey stones.
name: Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv

excerpt: Sprawling cultural space offering a variety of exhibits & vendors in a serene, parklike setting.
detail_description: The Expocenter of Ukraine, also known as VDNG, is a captivating cultural hub nestled in Kyiv that spans an impressive 286 hectares. This expansive exhibition complex, established in 1958 during the Soviet era, offers a delightful blend of history and modernity. Visitors can explore its stunning Stalinist Empire-style architecture while enjoying various events such as trade shows and cultural festivals. The serene park-like setting is perfect for leisurely strolls among beautiful pavilions and lush greenery.
name: Expo Center of Ukraine
address: Національний Експоцентр України, М01, Kyiv, Ukraine, 02000

excerpt: Formerly Viktor Yanukovych’s estate, this ornate house museum features a park, car collection & zoo.
detail_description: Located in the outskirts of Kyiv, Ukraine, the Mezhyhirya Residence is a sprawling estate that was once home to former Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych. Spanning over 150 hectares, this opulent complex features a mansion, private lake, golf course, and even a collection of exotic animals. Visitors can explore the ornate house museum and stroll through the beautiful gardens and cascading lakes at Mezhyhirya National Park.
name: Mezhyhirya Residence
address: Ivana Franka St, 19, Novi Petrivtsi, Kyiv Oblast, Ukraine, 07354

excerpt: Storied funicular along Volodymyrska Hill connecting the upper Old Town & lower Podil areas.
name: Kiev Funicular

excerpt: Hip music venues & food stalls in a one-time Communist-era factory with wacky sculpture displays.
detail_description: Art-zavod Platforma, located near the Lisova metro station in Kyiv, is a former Communist-era factory that has been transformed into a vibrant entertainment area. This urbanistic venue hosts various events such as concerts, festivals, and art exhibitions. Visitors can explore the abandoned workshops while enjoying music, food stalls, hookah lounges, and even alcohol vendors. The site also features wacky sculpture displays and offers ample parking space nearby.
name: Art-zavod Platforma

excerpt: Landscaped area with 5 lakes, woodland & paths, designated a state park for its biodiversity.
detail_description: Feofaniya Park, located on the outskirts of Kiev, is a historical and picturesque destination. The park boasts five lakes, woodland areas, and well-maintained paths that make it a state park recognized for its rich biodiversity. Professional landscape architects continuously enhance the park's beauty with medicinal plants like chamomile and lavender growing throughout the area.
name: Feofaniya Park

excerpt: Vast war memorial sculpted by Vuchetych & a museum displaying exhibits about WWII in the Ukraine.
detail_description: This war memorial consists of a massive statue of a Motherland holding a shield in one hand and an olive branch in the other, overlooking the city below. The museum which is located on the banks of the Dnieper River has exhibits about Ukraine's role in World War II from uniforms and letters to larger pieces of history like airplanes and artillery.
name: National Museum of the History of Ukraine in the Second World War

excerpt: City park perched on top of a hill, with a memorial & the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.
detail_description: Nestled atop a hill, the Park of Eternal Glory offers visitors a serene escape infused with historical significance. This beautifully designed park features an impressive observation deck that provides breathtaking views, alongside romantic gazebos and winding alleys lined with benches perfect for relaxation. Children can enjoy a delightful playground while families stroll through its expansive grounds, discovering unique corners filled with charm. Originally established in 1894 as Anosovsky Garden by Lieutenant-General Anosov, this area has transformed over the years.
name: Park of Eternal Glory
address: Lavrska St, 15, Kyiv, Київська обл., Ukraine, 01015

excerpt: Statue of the city founders on an ancient riverboat, surrounded by parkland on the Dnieper River.
detail_description: Nestled along the picturesque Dnieper River, the Kyiv Founders Monument is a captivating tribute to the legendary founders of the city: Kyi, Shchek, Khoryv, and their sister Lybid. This striking sculpture, crafted by Vasyl Borodai in 1982, features these figures standing proudly on an ancient riverboat amidst lush parkland.
name: Kyiv Founders Monument
address: вулиця Лаврська на набережній Дніпра, Kyiv, Ukraine, 02000

excerpt: Snug museum showcasing items from the 18th & 19th centuries, including manuscripts, photos & books.
detail_description: The One-Street Museum in Kiev is a cozy and popular attraction dedicated to the Andriyivskyy Descent, often referred to as the Montmartre of Kiev. Despite its small size, it houses a fascinating collection of items from the 18th and 19th centuries, including manuscripts, photos, books, vintage postcards, and autographs.
name: One-Street Museum

excerpt: Complex including old water towers & reservoirs, with displays on water including a children's area.
detail_description: The Museum of Water, situated in Kyiv, is housed in the city's 19th-century water tower and covers the entire hydrological cycle. It offers an educational experience on various aspects of water, including its movement underground and ways to conserve it. The museum also provides an entertaining program for children, making it a popular destination for families. Visitors can explore the history of urban water systems and gain insight into the value of water resources through informative displays.
name: Museum of Water

detail_description: When exploring the vibrant heart of Kyiv, one cannot miss TSUM, or the Central Department Store, located at the bustling intersection of Khreshchatyk Street and Bogdan Khmelnitsky Avenue. This iconic shopping destination beautifully marries history with modernity; originally constructed in Art Deco style between 1936 and 1939, it underwent a significant renovation from 2012 to 2017 while preserving its historic facade.
name: TSUM

excerpt: Sprawling national park featuring forest steppe landscapes, trails, ponds, playgrounds & eateries.
detail_description: Holosiivskyi National Natural Park is a vast expanse of forest steppe landscapes, offering an escape from the hustle and bustle of modern city life in Kiev. Just a short metro ride away from the city center, this park provides an immense area for outdoor activities such as hiking along trails, exploring ponds, and enjoying playgrounds and eateries.
name: Holosiivskyi National Natural Park

excerpt: An old arsenal complex is the setting for contemporary art exhibitions, workshops & a book festival.
detail_description: Mystetskyi Arsenal National Art and Culture Museum Complex is housed in an old arsenal complex and features contemporary art exhibitions, workshops, and a book festival. The Karas Gallery within the complex boasts a comprehensive collection of over 500 pieces by more than 100 Ukrainian artists. Notable works include those by Oleksiy Apollonov, Vasyl Bazhay, Petro Bevza, and many others.
name: Mystetskyi Arsenal National Art and Culture Museum Complex

excerpt: Laid-back restaurant serving international breakfasts, snacks & meals, plus desserts & cakes.
detail_description: Milk Bar is a trendy eatery that offers a relaxed atmosphere and a diverse menu featuring international breakfast options, snacks, meals, and an array of delectable desserts and cakes. The cafe's American-inspired aesthetic and vibrant display cases showcasing colorful biscuit cakes with cream glaze have made it a popular spot for avid photographers in Kiev. It has become a go-to destination for those with a sweet tooth, offering an indulgent selection of treats that are sure to satisfy any dessert craving.
name: Milk Bar

excerpt: Early-20th-century mansion with sculptures & ornate interiors in styles from Moorish to Byzantine.
detail_description: The Chocolate House is a neo-renaissance mansion in the wealthy district of Lypky. It was restored in 2009 and now houses an art gallery within Kyiv National Museum of Russian Art. The mansion has a brown block-like appearance, which is similar to the look of a candy bar.
name: Chocolate house
Bell tower of Saint Sophia's Cathedral

detail_description: Sikorsky International Airport Kyiv, also known as Zhuliany, is one of the two airports in Kiev. It is conveniently located about 7km from the city center. The airport offers a variety of amenities including smoking rooms and a range of shopping options for tobacco, alcohol, food, and more. Travelers can also enjoy dining at cafes and restaurants within the airport.
name: Sikorsky International Airport Kyiv

excerpt: Pyrohiv is a former village, now a residential neighbouhood, on the southern outskirts of Kyiv. It is located between Korchuvate, Kytaiv, and Vita-Lytovska neighbourhoods. The main streets are Pyrohivsky Shlyach and Laureatska. It is currently part of the city's Holosiivskyi District. Wikipedia.
detail_description: On the first day, start your journey from Kyiv's railway station at 8:00. Embark on a bus sightseeing tour of Kyiv and visit the iconic Kyiv Pechersk Lavra. Enjoy a delightful lunch in Pyrohiv village and take a leisurely walk around the largest skansen in Europe. Return to Kyiv for an evening walking excursion along Night Khreshchatyk before having dinner and checking into your hotel.
name: Pyrohiv

excerpt:
Zhuliany is a neighbourhood in the south-west of Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine. It is a predominantly cottage-built area, part of the Solomianskyi district. As well as Troieshchyna, Zhuliany became a part of Kyiv municipality in 1988.
The Kyiv International Airport is located in the neighborhood. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Zhuliany is a neighborhood situated in the south-west of Kyiv, Ukraine. It is primarily made up of cottage-style buildings and falls under the Solomianskyi district. Along with Troieshchyna, Zhuliany became part of Kyiv municipality in 1988. The area is home to the Kyiv International Airport, which is approximately 7km from the city center.
name: Zhuliany
Soviet Wonders - Tours on Post Soviet Countries
address: Vulytsya Ho'koho, 15, Чорнобиль, Kyiv Oblast, Ukraine, 07270

excerpt: Centuries-old, cobblestone road featuring art galleries, quaint shops & views of local landmarks.
detail_description: Andriyivskyy Descent is a winding, cobblestone road that descends from the Old Town in Kiev to Podil near the Dnieper River. It features art galleries and quaint shops, as well as views of local landmarks. The street has become one of the most popular tourist attractions in Kiev.
name: Andriivs'kyi descent

excerpt: Traditional Ukrainian buildings cluster together at this open-air museum of traditional life.
detail_description: The National Museum of Ukrainian Architecture and Culture is an open-air museum located in the south of Kiev that displays traditional Ukrainian buildings from different regions. The museum is a great way to learn about the traditional lifestyles of Ukrainians in different periods. There are more than 300 buildings, some dating back to the 16th century, in six villages that have been reassembled here.
name: National Museum of Folk Architecture and Life of Ukraine
